content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is a simple solution in Julia. This function uses the built-in `startswith` function to check if each word starts with an uppercase letter:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    result = Any[]
    for word in words
        if startswith(word, uppercase(first(word)))
            push!(result, word)
        end
    end
    return result
end
```
This function can be called as `keep_only_names([ "Dog", "dog", "Cat", "cat" ])`. It will return `[ "Dog" ]`, because only the first element in the list ("Dog") starts with an uppercase letter.
